messageBody:
On 15/11/05, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> On 11/14/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
> >
>
> I know, but you are answering my question by explaining how JUnit's
> implementation works.
>
> The point is that from a user's standpoint, it's very counter-intuitive, and
> Elliote's sending this email to the whole mailing-list to ask for help
> should be a red flag to everyone.

Elliotte bypassed the reflection-based test discovery by creating his
own test instances. Why is it then counter-intuitive that the
reflection-based test invocation failed?

This is no more counter-intuitive than asking why TestNG doesn't pick
up the tests marked with annotations when you bypass the
annotation-based ITestMethodFinder. The simple answer is: you broke
it, you fix it. In the case given, you "fix it" by overloading the
runTest() method, which is how the Parameterised Test pattern for
JUnit is almost always presented.
